acceptedAnswer.text: No. Every crash bet has negative expected value (-EV). You can't beat the math long-term. Play for entertainment, not profit.
Mathematically: None. All strategies are -EV. Practically: Low-multiplier cashout (1.5x-2x) + 1-2% bankroll per bet. Extends playtime, limits losses.
No. Crash rounds are generated via SHA-256 hashing. Bots can't predict future rounds. They're scams or malware.
A system where you can verify each round was generated fairly. The casino can't manipulate outcomes after you bet. Always choose provably fair casinos.

mainEntity.name: Why do I always crash at 1.00x?

acceptedAnswer.text: Variance. Low multipliers are most common. 1.00x crashes happen ~3% of the time (with 3% house edge). It feels frequent because you remember the pain, not the 2x wins.

mainEntity.name: Can I make a living playing crash?

acceptedAnswer.text: No. The math is against you. Professional gamblers don't play crashâ€”they play poker, sports betting, or card counting (where edge is possible).
